abstract: The billionaire financier Carl C. Icahn said Tuesday that he would provide some protection to smaller bondholders of the CIT Group who vote with him to reject the company’s plan for reorganization.
snippet: The billionaire financier Carl C. Icahn said Tuesday that he would provide some protection to smaller bondholders of the CIT Group who vote with him to reject the company’s plan for reorganization.
lead_paragraph: The billionaire financier Carl C. Icahn said Tuesday that he would provide some protection to smaller bondholders of the CIT Group who voted with him to reject the company’s plan for reorganization. The move is the latest in the contentious battle over the fate of CIT, a middle-market commercial lender that is trying to avoid bankruptcy.

headline.main: Icahn Makes Appeal to Small CIT Bondholders
